attributes.action: Secure derogations from EU treaties to allow the prohibition of foods that fail UK animal welfare standards
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
In June 2007, the prime minister's office rejected a petition calling for a ban on the sale of foie gras in the UK on the grounds that it would place the country in violation of EU treaties.

This situation undermines the UK's efforts to improve the welfare of animals involved in food production. It encourages inhumane food producers to simply export their business to another EU country, such as France, where animal cruelty is more greatly tolerated.

This petition asks the prime minister to secure derogations from the appropriate EU treaties to ensure that the UK reserves the right to refuse the import of foods produced in a manner that would not be tolerated under its own animal welfare legislation.
